etymology.description: 堂 (hall) + 食 (eat/food) = dine in (eat in the hall/restaurant).
etymology.interpretation: Literally means eating in a hall or dining area; by extension in modern usage, it contrasts with takeout or delivery. Emphasizes consuming food on the premises.

parts.english: hall; main room; reception hall; auditorium

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅可以堂食也可以外卖(這家餐廳可以堂食也可以外賣)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng kěyǐ tángshí yě kěyǐ wàimài.
examples.english: This restaurant offers dine-in as well as takeout.

examples.chinese: 服务员问我们是堂食还是打包(服務員問我們是堂食還是打包)。
examples.pinyin: Fúwùyuán wèn wǒmen shì tángshí háishì dǎbāo.
examples.english: The server asked whether we were dining in or getting it to go.

examples.chinese: 疫情过后，更多人选择堂食(疫情過後，更多人選擇堂食)。
examples.pinyin: Yìqíng guòhòu, gèng duō rén xuǎnzé tángshí.
examples.english: After the pandemic, more people choose to dine in.
